# Quick Start Guide

Get started with Vargula in 5 minutes!

## Basic Text Styling

### Using `style()`

```python
import vargula as vg

# Colors
print(vg.style("Success!", color="green"))
print(vg.style("Error!", color="red", look="bold"))

# Backgrounds
print(vg.style("Highlighted", bg="yellow", color="black"))

# Hex colors
print(vg.style("Custom", color="#FF5733"))
```

### Using Markup Tags

```python
# HTML-like tags
vg.write("This is <red>red</red> and <blue>blue</blue>")
vg.write("<bold>Bold text</bold> with <italic>italic</italic>")

# Nested tags
vg.write("<bold><red>Bold and red!</red></bold>")
```

## Custom Styles

Create reusable styles:

```python
# Define once
vg.create("error", color="red", look="bold")
vg.create("success", color="green", look="bold")

# Use everywhere
vg.write("<e>Error occurred</e>")
vg.write("<success>Task completed</success>")
```

## Simple Table

```python
table = vg.Table(title="Task Status")
table.add_column("Task", style="cyan")
table.add_column("Status", style="green")
table.add_row("Compile code", "✓ Done")
table.add_row("Run tests", "⏳ Running")
print(table)
```

## Progress Bar

```python
import time

for item in vg.progress_bar(range(100), desc="Processing"):
    time.sleep(0.02)
```

## Color Palette

```python
colors = vg.generate_palette("#3498db", "complementary", 5)
print(vg.preview_palette(colors))
```

## Complete Example

```python
import vargula as vg
import time

# Setup theme
vg.set_theme("dark")

# Display header
vg.write("<bold><cyan>=== System Status ===</cyan></bold>\n")

# Create table
table = vg.Table(title="Services", border_style="cyan")
table.add_column("Service", style="bold")
table.add_column("Status", style="green")
table.add_row("API Server", "✓ Running")
table.add_row("Database", "✓ Running")
print(table)

# Show progress
for _ in vg.progress_bar(range(50), desc="Checks"):
    time.sleep(0.02)

vg.write("<success>✓ All tasks completed!</success>")
```
